location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Copy of letter No. 10/6 of 1873 from Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, On Special Duty, at Simla, to The Secretary of Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding three horses which were presented by Seyyid Torkee [Turki bin Said Al Said], Sultan of Muscat to Sir Bartle Frere and himself.The letter encloses a memorandum of expenses occured in the feeding and shipping of the horses to Bombay and reports that the horses are awaiting sale at Bombay, prior to the account being settled.
